pullRequest.title: Support Debian 9/10 as clients
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
Debian 9 and 10 bootstrap support
add description
Debian 9 and 10 onboarding support  (fully tested):


mgr_bootstrap_data.py added debian 9 and 10 required packages and basechannels


susemanager-sls corrected jinja to remove minor version from URL - no necessary on debian systems and added state to install gnupg required by debian family to import gpg key


rhn_bootstrap_strings.py removed minor version from the URL


spacewalk-common-channels.ini added Master and Stable repo for both debian 9 and 10


adedd -uyuni suffix to debian 9 and 10 repo + changelog updated


GUI diff
No difference.
Before:
After:

 DONE

Documentation


No documentation needed: add explanation. This can't be used if there is a GUI diff


doc-susemanager PR or issue was created (GitHub automatic link expected below)


 DONE


Test coverage


No tests: add explanation


Unit tests were added


Cucumber tests were added


 DONE


Links
Fixes #
Tracks # add downstream PR, if any

 DONE

Changelogs
If you don't need a changelog check, please mark this checkbox:

 No changelog needed

If you uncheck the checkbox after the PR is created, you will need to re-run changelog_test (see below)
Re-run a test
If you need to re-run a test, please mark the related checkbox, it will be unchecked automatically once it has re-run:

 Re-run test "changelog_test"
 Re-run test "backend_unittests_pgsql"
 Re-run test "java_lint_checkstyle"
 Re-run test "java_pgsql_tests"
 Re-run test "ruby_rubocop"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_oracle"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_pgsql"
 Re-run test "susemanager_unittests"
 Re-run test "javascript_lint"
 Re-run test "spacecmd_unittests"

commit.message:
Update mgr_bootstrap_data.py

added debian 9 and 10 packages and repos

Update mgr_bootstrap_data.py

debian 9 and 10 packages and repos - indentation corrected

Update init.sls

debian 9-10 onboarding - attempt unsuccessful throws the following error on the UI:

pkg_|-salt-minion-package_|-salt-minion_|-latest(retcode=2): No information found for 'salt-minion'. file_|-/etc/salt/minion_id_|-/etc/salt/minion_id_|-managed(retcode=2): One or more requisite failed: bootstrap.salt-minion-package file_|-/etc/salt/pki/minion/minion.pem_|-/etc/salt/pki/minion/minion.pem_|-managed(retcode=2): One or more requisite failed: bootstrap.salt-minion-package service_|-salt-minion_|-salt-minion_|-running(retcode=2): One or more requisite failed: bootstrap.salt-minion-package, bootstrap./etc/salt/minion.d/susemanager.conf, bootstrap./etc/salt/pki/minion/minion.pem, bootstrap./etc/salt/minion_id, bootstrap./etc/salt/pki/minion/minion.pub file_|-/etc/salt/minion.d/susemanager.conf_|-/etc/salt/minion.d/susemanager.conf_|-managed(retcode=2): One or more requisite failed: bootstrap.salt-minion-package file_|-/etc/salt/pki/minion/minion.pub_|-/etc/salt/pki/minion/minion.pub_|-managed(retcode=2): One or more requisite failed: bootstrap.salt-minion-package

Debian 9 and 10 onboarding support (NOTE debian 10 not fully tested yet):
- mgr_bootstrap_data.py added debian 9 and 10 required packages and 
basechannels
- susemanager-sls corrected jinja to remove minor version from URL - no 
necessary on debian systems and added python3-apt and 
apt-transport-https to the list of basic pkgs
- rhn_bootstrap_strings.py removed minor version from the URL and 
modified so now apt-transport-https gets installed before using debian 
systems with the bootstrap script

nodes.bodyText:
Do not include the 'astra' changes. I will do it on my PR.
This should look like as:
     if [ "${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}" == "debian" ]; then
CLIENT_REPO_URL="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MAJOR_VERSION}}/bootstrap"
     else
CLIENT_REPO_URL="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MAJOR_VERSION}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MINOR_VERSION}}/bootstrap"
    fi

Also review the spacing, just in case (quickly retry the script).

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -622,12 +622,26 @@ def getRegistrationStackSh(saltEnabled):
     getA_MISSING
 
     CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT:-${{HTTPS_PUB_DIRECTORY}}/repositories}}"
-    CLIENT_REPO_URL="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MAJOR_VERSION}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MINOR_VERSION}}/bootstrap"
+    if [ "${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}" == "astra" ]; then
+        CLIENT_REPO_URL="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}/${{A_CLIENT_VARIANT_ID}}/bootstrap"
+      # Debian does not need minor version in the bootstrap repo URL
+     elif [ "${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}" == "debian" ]; then
+        CLIENT_REPO_URL="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MAJOR_VERSION}}/bootstrap"
+     else
+        CLIENT_REPO_URL="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MAJOR_VERSION}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MINOR_VERSION}}/bootstrap"
+    fi
     CLIENT_REPO_NAME="susemanager_bootstrap"
     CLIENT_REPO_FILE="/etc/apt/sources.list.d/$CLIENT_REPO_NAME.list"
 
     setup_deb_bootstrap_repo
 
+    # Debian vanilla install requires apt-transport-https prior salt-minion installation otherwise will fail
+    APT_TRANSPORT_HTTPS_DEB=$(wget -O - http://$HOSTNAME/pub/repositories/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MAJOR_VERSION}}/bootstrap/pool/main/a/apt/ /dev/null 2>&1 |grep apt-transport-https|cut -d '"' -f 6)

nodes.bodyText:
Leave only:
- Enable support for bootstrapping Debian 9 and 10

And let's test Debian 10 :-)

nodes.bodyText:
To be honest, if we are going to have debian9-amd64-uyuni here, I wonder if we shouldn't have the uyuni prefix at spacewalk-common-channels repositories as well, in preparation for a future Debian support at SUSE Manager.
@paususe?

commit.message: required changes applied ref: Debian9/10 poc #1917
Removed code to install apt-transport-https on debian 9 install
Debian 9 and 10 onboarding successfully tested from the UI and scripts
final commit - debian 9 and 10 onboarding support fully tested

nodes.bodyText: Please add a changelog entry at spacewalk-certs-tools.changes.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -622,7 +622,12 @@ def getRegistrationStackSh(saltEnabled):
     getA_MISSING
 
     CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT:-${{HTTPS_PUB_DIRECTORY}}/repositories}}"
-    CLIENT_REPO_URL="${{CLIENT_REPOS_ROOT}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_BASE}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MAJOR_VERSION}}/${{A_CLIENT_CODE_MINOR_VERSION}}/bootstrap"
+    # Debian does not need minor version in the bootstrap repo URL

nodes.bodyText:
As in the end we are adding -uyuni  suffix to bootstrap to support Debian both now on Uyuni and on SUSE Manager later, may I suggest you duplocate Debian 9 and Debian 10 here, and you add -uyuni to the labels and names, just as we do for Ubuntu above?
This will also require a change at susemanager/src/mgr_bootstrap_data.py and the doc for PR.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1332,6 +1332,24 @@ checksum = sha256
 base_channels = debian-9-pool-amd64
 repo_url = http://security-cdn.debian.org/debian-security/dists/stretch/updates/main/binary-amd64/
 
+[debian-9-amd64-uyuni-client-master]
+label    = debian-9-amd64-uyuni-client-master
+name     = Uyuni Master Client Tools for Debian 9 Stretch AMD64
+archs    = amd64-deb
+repo_type = deb
+checksum = sha256
+base_channels = debian-9-pool-amd64
+repo_url = https://download.opensuse.org/repositories/systemsmanagement:/Uyuni:/Master:/Debian9-Uyuni-Client-Tools/Debian_9/
+
+[debian-9-amd64-uyuni-client-stable]
+label    = debian-9-amd64-uyuni-client-stable
+name     = Uyuni Stable Client Tools for Debian 9 Stretch AMD64
+archs    = amd64-deb
+repo_type = deb
+checksum = sha256
+base_channels = debian-9-pool-amd64
+repo_url = https://download.opensuse.org/repositories/systemsmanagement:/Uyuni:/Stable:/Debian9-Uyuni-Client-Tools/Debian_9/
+
 [debian-10-pool-amd64]

commit.message: adedd -uyuni suffix to debian 9 and 10 repo + changlog updated

nodes.bodyText:
Mmmmm, why do we have this and the next channel, if we already have debian-10-amd64-uyuni-client-stable and debian-10-amd64-uyuni-client-master below?
Also, despite it was not changed by this PR, can we change -master to -devel as we have for all other OS, and remove -stable as we have for all other OS?

commit.message: Changed suffix -devel and update name entry

nodes.bodyText: Don't add your email to the changelog entry.
